Incredibly eloquent. Fantastic at prompting and guiding discussion in small seminars. Her handouts on paper-writing and her writing advice is the most valuable I have ever received, and has clearly improved my grades in all subjects.
An exceptional talent and very inspiring to have her teach, especially as an expat Aussie myself.
Smoking hot.
Awful.

How could anyone call her awful? She made me completely reconsider my major--her English lectures were so exciting--she brought the authors to life! I went to her classes while sick! And her comments on my papers were extensive, helpful and lucid. I would take anything by her and you should to!
awful.

802583.name: Stephen Kotkin
comments: Best class I have ever taken.
Dr.Kotkin is a great scholar and a historian, I enjoyed his lecture and loved his book, "Armageddon Averted".

I heard Dr. Kotkin lecture once and all I can say is WOW! Imagine the voice of Joe Pesci with the ability to leave you hanging on every word he says. Magnetic Mountain and Armageddon Averted are two of his books that I own and have read. He is truly a great historian and from what I have seen a great professor. Good guy too.

1462638.name: Russell Nieli
comments: Very interesting lectures! Manages to explain difficult topics!
Great at explaining otherwise dense text. Thoroughly enjoyed coming to class with him, and encourage anyone taking a class with him to stay and talk after.
Really enjoyed Professor Nieli. He was so much fun! I had an awesome Summer experience, and it was a challenging course
Intelligent, yet has a difficult way of conveying it. Is not smooth in speech, and says "Umm" far too often. However, he is all together intelligent, and well read.
He is smart but the way he speaks isnt the smoothest or most interesting.

999616.name: Fei-Fei Li
comments: Great class. She makes lectures and references to the textbook clear. Only problem is that it is rather hand-wavy at times but perhaps this is understandable, since it is an introductory class. Good introduction to computer vision. I would recommend this class to new-comers.
Great class

556516.name: Robert George
comments: Brilliant lecturer. Engages students in a large lecture. Examines both sides to arguments and leaves his personal politics outside the classroom. A wonderful experience.
Amazing teacher. Fair. Honest. Brilliant. Cares about students.

A must for students who want a real education. The constitutional issues discussed would interest any modern American. This course makes students think with the clarity one should expect to have on leaving college. Professor George is rightly known for his fairness, interest in his students, and his love for lively but respectful debate.

Professor George's courses on constitutional interpretation and civil liberties are a must for any Princeton student interested in responsible citizenship. I've heard so many people remark that while their personal interests lie outside of politics, George's classes taught them the kind of critical thinking necessary for a democracy to thrive.

By far one of the best classes I took at Princeton. Professor George does an excellent job of challenging students to articulate both sides of the issue. His classes equipped me with the intellectual tools to critically evaluate controversial issues from all angles.
One of the best classes I had at Princeton. Professor George challenged us to examine our beliefs, no matter what they were. Talented lecturer and excellent material.
Professor George was the best teacher I encountered at Princeton. He led terrific class discussions, and really stretched students to consider alternate points of view.
One of my best professors at Princeton. Hard but fair.

I suspect that the two hateful comments in this thread weren't written by Princeton students; all the Princeton students I know can express their opinions in a more grownup fashion. Professor George's courses were the two best of my entire time at Princeton. His clarity, civility, and eye-opening insight changed the course of my academic career.

This is the best professor I ever had. Because of this class, I majored in the Politics department at Princeton, and went on to a top law school. I still remember things he said when he taught. This is THE top Professor at Princeton.

Congenial, deadly brilliant, unassuming, provocative, necessary for a complete Princeton experience. His liberal colleagues have only the highest respect for him and have given him the country's most respected constitutional law chair. 'Nough said.
really smart and clear

As a true-blue liberal, I must say that I LOVED his classes -- what an eye-opener! He's brilliant, probably the best professor I've ever had, and single-handedly impacted my career decisions. Take the course, be prepared to do worse than you might in other classes -- you will definitely benefit.
Take only if you have the stones to be shocked out of your blue state bigotry. RG is smart and provocative. He will shatter your complacency.
One of the best reasons to go here. Intelligent and insightful.
Rocks
Great.
Awesome.
classes and reading are generally thought-provoking and balanced, but he is a bit of a prima donna. a lot depends on your preceptor (avoid oakley)
No Comments

1889152.name: Andrew Ford
comments: I learned to go from translating to reading
Outstanding professor. Ford is a blast to have class with: he's helpful and energetic, but he's a difficult grader.

327711.name: John Conway
comments: I attended a seminar Conway held at West Chester University of PA on surreal numbers. He is a genius, and it shows. He's hard to follow at times, and moves very quickly, but that comes with the brilliance. I recommend math majors/graduates see him any chance you get, it's an unforgettable experience.
I had this professor during FSI2006, and I'm surprised I passed.
No Comments

Conway's very hard to follow, and there was almost no class structure at all. Oddly, this didn't hinder most of the class at all; he's an incredible genius, and a great lecturer besides. Just ASK EVERY QUESTION YOU CAN, and the class'll be the most fun you've ever had.
Conway's a force to behold. Just make sure you stop him to ask questions, or he'll zip by you and not even realize it.
He looks like Santa Claus. He invented surreal numbers. He has been to Japan. He is hot. He will have visited the state of Michigan at least twice by the end of the year. TJCG is EXTREME.

138362.name: Jamie Rankin
comments: Janie Rankin has helped decades of students not only learn German but get excited about it. Its not only his teaching but what he did to establish excellence in teaching of beginner/intermediate German students across the department.

By far the best language teacher I have ever had. He is knowledgeable, engaging, and sincerely wants to help. You actually want to do all of the homework he assigns because the more time you spend on the homework, the more active you can be in class. If every teacher were like him, students would be way more responsive to college work.

I had the privilege of taking Prof. Rankin's class while at Binghamton (a long time ago)...my first college class. When I found this site, he's the first prof I looked up, these many years later. That should tell you how highly I think of him. Genuine, passionate, brilliant. jawohl!

I agree with the other rater - Jamie Rankin was the best professor I had at Princeton in all my four years. Thanks to his teaching, I was proficient in a foreign language in 10 months and I am still highly proficient in German, 8 years later! Vielen dank, Herr Rankin!

Herr Rankin ist sehr toll! Jamie Rankin is definitely one of the most pedagogically gifted people I've ever met. From the very first class, he's speaking German to you and you're speaking German back. Nothing short of miraculous.
Without a doubt, the best professor I had during four years at Princeton.

708485.name: Claire Gmachl
comments: Most Students usually find her classes not too hard because she as actually really good at teaching.
Professor Gmachl is awesome and extremely smart.

786473.name: Tomoko Shibata
comments: best decision you could ever make
No Comments
Funny lady. Good teacher. Very nice.

105956.name: Tamsen Wolff
comments: Best lectures of my life. This class--Contemporary Drama--is amazing.
TAMSEN IS A GENIUS

Amazing. Professor Wolff brings up great points and completely engages the class. She's quirky and funny and her lectures are incredible. I had heard she was brilliant but terrifying, but she's just brilliant. She's a serious grader, but totally fair.

I had her for contemporary drama and I loved every minute of it (okay maybe one or two of the plays I could have done without, but they were all included for a reason). She's fantastic. Her lectures are smart and funny, and my writing really improved with her help. I loved this class.
Take a class with her! I liked her so much, I asked her to be my advisor. She's amazing.

I can't say enough good things about Tamsen. I was excited to come to every class. In fact I don't think anyone was absent all semester. I learned so much, not just about contemporary plays but about theatre and how it works and about writing. Tamsen is tough but fair, she's hilarious and she's really helpful. One of the best classes I've taken.
If you don't fall in love with plays (or her) you're crazy.
Hands down, the single best professor I encountered during all four years of college.

She is overrated in every possible sense. Hottest in the ivy league (you gotta be kidding!) If we want to be in a class where the teacher shamelessly panders to musical theater geeks then take this class. The fact that she got tenure at Princeton is staggering and as utterly incomprehensible and nonsensical as her lectures, which she works hard
wonderful class, really fun prof. she knows an amazing amount of stuff about theater
No Comments
cool young hip
No Comments
No Comments

1793488.name: Cagan Yalama
comments: One of the hardest classes I had last year, but listen to him carefully - he actually tells the final questions in the class.
very hard physics teacher
10/10 would take class third time
I took his Thermodynamics course which was easier than I predicted. He knows a lot about everything but his tests are kinda hard. He doesnt take attendance so come and go as you please
This is my second time taking Physics, and his class was much more informative and easier to understand. I wish I had him last year.

1186025.name: Selig Ralph
comments: He is one of the best that Princeton has to offer
Very good Very Patient
He is very patient,and explains well.
Explains clearly

2097447.name: Maria Garlock
comments: Great Professor that has an amazing family I extremely enjoy hearing stories about!!! :)I strongly recomend
She was a great professor and anyone interested in the arts and the details in this world and I would recommend you to take her class she was awesome!!!!!
